runs.comm: full length, on off stump, defended
lovely strike. Not a lot wrong with the ball, but a firm blade and perfect placement, too straight for mid-off
good riposte. On off stump, curling back into a defensive push
inswinging yorker, picked early and drilled to mid-on
driven off a slight inside-edge to midwicket. Thinking of two, but think better of it
short, and lifting into the splice. Defended with a hop
short and nudged off the hip to backward square leg
short, pulled firmly but straight to the sweeper at deep midwicket
bread-and-butter for Smith as he nurdles a single off his massive pads
crunched over the covers! Too full and Bosman loves to free his arms. Top tonking
much straighter, but again too full, and Bosman whips a lofted clip through midwicket
that's better, Rainsford pulls his length back half a yard, and Bosman defends
swished in the air to deep midwicket. Doesn't pick out a fielder, but plugs on landing
too short, and pulled into the gap at midwicket. No great timing, but placement was everything
short, punched off the back foot, a slight fumble could have given away a single
this is the wrong length to a player of the class of Smith. All the time in the world to pick his spot and smack another pull
Smith gives himself room, Mpofu overcompensates and gives away a wide down the leg side
good interception as Smith blazed a drive back at the bowler. A valuable dot ball!
inside-out and a lofted drive to complete a strong over for Smith and South Africa
better line and length, defended to point
cramped for room, a chiselled pull lobs to mid-on
Smith senses vulnerability and climbs into a pre-meditated drive. Doesn't get hold of it properly, but the intent is plain
gives himself room, clips a drive to mid-on
sweetly struck! A fraction over-pitched? Not much wrong with the ball, but it's being fished out of the long-off stand as we speak!
that was definitely too short, and Bosman hoisted it over the covers for another six!
worked down to fine leg
down on one knee, swept fine, delicately done
Smith makes room, Utseya drops short, and that's another slammed boundary through midwicket!
driven uppishly into the covers
quicker ball, flailed into the covers
driven hard, in the air but past the bowler, and away for another boundary
dismissive. Military medium pace, flogged over the bowler's head
more of the same. Slight outside edge this time, but the same result, over extra cover this time
massive. Flatter delivery, flatter strike. Through midwicket with lots of bottom hand, and into the stands
a dot ball! In the blockhole, driven back into Masakadza's outstretched hand
dropped! And that was awful. A gentle clip outside leg, and Mpofu at short fine leg muffs the catch
that's the end of the Powerplay. Not before time from Zimbabwe's point of view
pulled effortlessly out to deep midwicket
lofted into the leg side, evades two fielders and the scoreboard clicks up again
tapped to midwicket
too easy. Down on one knee, imperious slog sweep into the stands, and that is Smith's fifty
driven with an open face to mid-on
there's the breakthrough! Smacked down the ground, but picks out Taylor with a tumble at deep cover
clipped into the gap
there's just no stopping the ex-skipper, who is keen to demonstrate that the loss of the captaincy hasn't affected his appetite for big runs. Smacked through midwicket
and there he goes. Down on one knee again, but for once misses out, and is struck flush in front of middle.
whipped to midwicket to get off the mark
stands tall and cracks a cut straight to cover
flapped down the ground to complete the over
quick single to keep the requirement at a run a ball
twirled onto a good length. Strikes the pad but a long way down
dabbed into the covers, one more to the total
on the pads, flicked firmly, and that's another wicket! Easily swallowed by Masakadza at deep backward square, and suddenly ...
forward and poked into the covers
stands tall and swatted out to short cover
tries to find room on the leg-side, but short fine-leg cuts off the run
clipped out to midwicket
forward and defended
a touch of spin, and defended again
pushed into the covers
whoops, a fine over has been ruined by some abject fielding, a firm sweep through square leg, and the man dives straight over the ball
on the hip, tucked square
keeps low, but swept hard, along the ground, and that flummoxed the fielder who didn't expect such pace on the shot
worked into the leg-side
on the pads, nurdled for another single
cut firmly to the point sweeper
a spurious call for a single leads to four overthrows! A clip to midwicket, Miller rightly refused to run, but the shy went wide as Duminy dived for the crease
high and handsome, way over deep midwicket! Good use of the feet
sl-oo-ow spin. Pulled to midwicket
more good footwork, right to the pitch of the ball, and hoisted over long-on. Top shot
twirling delivery, worked to the leg side
short. Pulled. Four. Easy
banged in short, cut to gully
short ball, well bowled. Duminy lets it go
deflected to fine leg
short and an attempted pull. Beaten
short and worked square
low full-toss, swinging away, driven to short cover
firm backfoot drive to mid-off
short again, and pulled out to midwicket
nudged down to third man
short and pulled hard through the gap. The length was going to be latched onto at some stage
much fuller this time, and an open-faced wallop over the covers
compact drive to mid-off, a quick single, and that is Miller's career-best, one ball after the fifty stand
short and pulled, but intercepted at short midwicket
lucky to get away with that one, short and wide, and left alone
smacked hard, well half-stopped by short cover
slower ball, held back and dabbed to third man
goes for the yorker, but strikes the pad outside leg
on the hip, nudged to square leg
slapped drive, down to mid-on, where a low chance bounces just short
cut out to point
trading in singles to bring the requirement down
a teasing cut, into the gap at cover. No-one can cut it off
and there it is! A flowing drive over long-on, just clears the rope, and South Africa ease home with more than four overs to spare
